Comments_List: Excellent introduction to labor economics through presenting foundational  models and research papers. Great review of microeconomic ideas and econometrics.
I learned the relevance of math in the study of economics. This class not only explained how to do the math but why it is necessary.
I learned about labor supply and demand, employment and wages in the US. I learned a lot of theoretical model to understand labor market.
All great, just need to change the time we meet.
Given the small number of students in the class, I thought it might have been if this was a seminar instead of lecture format.

I without a doubt would recommend this class. I am not someone who excelled in the intro and intermediate sequences, so I was nervous taking this class. However, Professor Lindenlaub explain difficult subjects extremely well. She also uses recently published papers to teach us the topics, which is something I found extremely cool. This class changed my opinion on economics. Ive come out of the class with a revived interest in the subject.
Definitely, I would recommend this course to you if you are interested in learning theoretical models of the labor market. It helps us understand the determinants of wages and employment.
